greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest linear combination of phi(n) and sigma(n) with nonnegative coefficients: a(n) = Min_{x>=0,y>=0} (x+y) for which x*phi(n) + y*sigma(n) is a multiple of n.
comment: a(n) is a generalization of the multiperfect numbers in A007691.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..12857
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
example: a(6) = 1 as 1*sigma(6) is a multiple of 6.
a(4) = 2 as 2*phi(4) + 0*sigma(4) = 4. - Example added by _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 24 2020
results.author: _Walter Nissen_, May 20 2004
